txt.en: There are no enemies in sight, but something catches your eye
There are no enemies in sight, but something catches your eye
There are no enemies in sight, but something catches your eye
Foreman Mögr, frustrated by Reinn's obstinance about the security of Zelem-melek, wishes to prove to you that the Twenty-first Hall is as safe as can be.
Mögr dismisses the potential dangers and problems you witnessed

'I grow weary of Reinn's constant fretting. His open complaints are bad for business here, you know.

'How about this: you are new here, and unbiased. Why not patrol the wide hall? If it is free of enemies, Reinn must put his fears to rest.

'I believe this is a fair compromise. If I am right, my dwarves can celebrate their victory without hesitation.'
The Twenty-first Hall is an enormous pillared hall covering northern Zelem-melek.\n\nYou should patrol the hall and see if enemies are about.

You inform Mögr of the clear pathways, but also of the glaring problems you observed in the Twenty-first Hall.\n\n'No enemies, just as I said! Do you see, Reinn? It is time to quit your crusade against our folk celebrating their victory in claiming Zelem-melek for the expedition!'
Mögr is in the Twenty-first Hall of Moria.\n\nYou should return to Mögr with a report of what you saw on your patrol.
Reinn is in the Twenty-first Hall.\n\nYou should hear what Reinn thinks of your findings.
'Are you blind, Mögr? [placeholder] reported many other things amiss: crumbling supports, filth everywhere, and evidence that Orcs or goblins came through here not long ago at all.'
Patrol the west side of the hall
Patrol the south side of the hall
Patrol the east side of the hall
Return to Mögr with your findings
